40.content:
(Title: The Enemy of my Enemy
Enemies: A tribe of goblinoids, a tribe of lizardmen, and a tribe of rat men all battle each other for control of this floor.
Boss: A Nalfeshnee is manipulating the tribes to fight with his magic, enjoying the chaos and death he creates.
Environment: Series of caves dotted with crude fortifications and the remains of past tribal attacks.
Treasure: Each tribe has 1/3rd of a staff of power, which, when combined, allows a spellcaster to greatly empower their spells.
Traps: Many crude traps, but the rat men have gas mines and lightning bolt traps in their domain.
Notes: Each tribe has a leader. A bugbear for the goblinoids, a crocodile hybrid lizard man chief, and a rat man priest to their god of decay. )

41.content:
(Title: The Fight of the Bumblebee
Enemies: Giant Bees, Drones, Soldiers, and Elite Males that guard the queen in her chamber.
Boss: Queen Bee who can cast druid spells
Environment: Massive hive
Treasure: Royal Jelly heals wounds like a healing potion. Enough for 20 doses.
Traps: None
Notes: The bees all have human arms and legs, and their larva look like fetuses with bee heads.)

42.content:
(Title: Somewhere Under the Dungeon
Enemies: Flying ape men above the water, drowned zombies beneath.
Boss: A green hag who lives in the tower with her flying ape minions
Environment: An underwater lake dotted with islands and a large tower in the center.
Treasure: The hag has a crystal ball fit for scrying. On an abandoned island in the lake are a pair of ruby slippers that allow one character to teleport outside the dungeon.
Traps: None
Notes: The Hag melts if she touches water.)

43.content:
(Title: Out of the Frying Pan
Enemies: Fire Giants, Fire elementals, Salamanders, young red dragons.
Boss: Kary a fire infused Marilith with two dozen arms and a snake tail instead of legs.
Environment: A volcanic rock and glass cave structure, dotted with pits of lava. Hot and the air is bad quality. 
Treasure: A pair of magical Scimitars, one deals ice damage, the other fire. Kary wields them.
Traps: Occasional burst lava bubbles from the pits shower everyone nearby.
Notes: Metal armor is too uncomfortable to wear here without magical assistance.)

44.content:
(Title: The Engine of Yargxag
Enemies: Automaton guards with four spider legs, a shield and a spear in hand. They can fire small beams of light from the tip of their spear.
Boss: A clockwork choir of a dozen angels with bellows that power their flight as well as their song. Each is armed with a longsword. One of the angels has sheet music.
Environment: The inside of a clockwork mechanism that seemingly drives other sections of the dungeon, it's source of power coming from another level.
Treasure: The sheet music, if sung correctly, will make any automated defenses in the dungeon ignore you, including automatons. The angel's swords are all holy weapons.
Traps: Sections of this floor reshape themselves in real time.
Notes: Guards are aggressive. Damaging the mechanics summons more guards. Small worker drones are common, fixing, repairing and constructing new sections.)

45.content:
(Title: Paint it Black
Enemies: Shades and shadow creatures
Boss: A giant of pure light, a prisoner here, driven mad by the darkness.
Environment: Impossibly black rock cavern and tunnels, oozing with pitch black liquid. Light doesn't reflect off surfaces here. Darkness.
Treasure: The giant of light drops luminous armor, a bright suit of magically protective plate mail that weights almost nothing. 
Traps: Open pit traps that are easy to miss in the darkness.
Notes: Magical light spells and effects do not function on this floor. Natural light sources are half as effective.)

46.content:
(Title: Cocoon: The Return
Enemies: Fleshcrafters: Centipede human hybrids with the bottom half of their bodies replaced with a massive centipede's back half. They have paralyzing pinchers on the end of their tails as well as silk spinnerets that can shoot and spray a slow-acting paralyzing silk. 
Boss: A large cocoon containing a Storm Giant/Blue Dragon hybrid monstrosity that bursts forth when the party arrives in its chamber.
Environment: Silk lined stone hallways. Warm and moist.
Treasure: In the entrance chamber is a barely struggling cocoon on the wall by the safe room door. It contains {{random:Celine,Margot,Sapphire,Rachel,Eris,Keira,Sera,Lexa,Isolde,Talia,Maribelle,Cassia,Daphne,Fiora,Nyalah}} who is screaming for help, her head poking out of the cocoon she is trapped in, manaless. She is mostly unharmed, and introduces herself immediately begging to be freed. If that person is already present than her name is Melora and she is a Tiefling Enchantress that seems perpetually annoyed at everything.
Traps: Some cocoons contain strange monster hybrids that jump out and attack if touched or attacked.
Notes: The Fleshcrafters can merge two types of creatures together when cocooned together. The process takes a week. They've only perfected making more of themselves, other hybrids have varying results.)

47.content:
(Title: The Gold Room
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A gold plated chamber with a pile of coins and an open treasure chest glowing from within with golden light.
Treasure: 500 gold coins and a golden longbow "The Bow of Apollo" It fires seeking arrows of sunlight that never miss their target.
Traps: None
Notes: A treasure room.)

48.content:
(Title: What are ya buyin?
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A ramshackle shop made of discard materials in a swampy sewer. The shopkeeper is a filthy and disfigured looking human weary ratty robes and has a half covered face. He has a large number of items of for sale, and is willing to buy, sell, and trade.
Treasure: 10 healing potions for 2 gold apiece. Scrolls for 5 gold apiece, he has Web, Scorching Ray, Dimension Door, Bless, Sanctuary, Summon Nature's Ally, Flaming Sphere, wall of ice, and lightning bolt. He has a Staff of Lighting for 100 gold or for trade. He has a magically silenced mithril chain shirt for 250 gold or for trade. The armor offers superior protection at no chance of spell failure and it is light as a feather and just as quiet. His last item is "Götterdämmerung" a two handed greathammer artifact weapon with etchings on it's adamantine surface depicting several gods weeping. It's power and strength is obvious: At the height of his madness Yargxag created this weapon to challenge the divine realms. It is priced at 500 gold or for trade. 
Traps: The shopkeeper, his shop and all his wares disappear if anyone tries to steal an item or harm him.
Notes: The shopkeeper is a ruthless but fair appraiser and will always offer a fair value for his trades. He accepts flesh as well as coin.)

49.content:
(Title: Castle in the Sky
Enemies: Air elementals, Wind drakes, Arrowhawks, Birdmen monk initiates.
Boss: Four powerful Birdmen monks, each dedicated to a spirit of the four winds with their own unique magical martial art style. They are sworn to protect the level exit with their lives.
Environment: The floor and ceiling are expansive portals to the Plane of Air. Floating between are various islands hovering in the air connected by rope bridges. The largest island is the last in the chain and holds up a large eastern-styled castle fortress, guarded by Birdmen monks.
Treasure: The four monks guard a relic known as "The Ring of the Four Winds." It allows the bearer to attack at range with their melee attacks up to 100 feet in the form of sudden gusts of concussive force that strike the victim.
Traps: Some of the bridges are rickety or missing footholds in places.
Notes: To fall into the Plane of Air is to fall forever.)

key: Well Actually it's a Hot Chicks Room
50.content:
(Title: Well Actually it's a Hot Chicks Room
Enemies: Cloud Giant Harem Guards
Boss: Temptation
Environment: A complex of gardens, lounges, conservatories, menageries, plazas, balconies, ballrooms, and libraries. A place of beauty, happiness and peace. It is filled only with women of legendary beauty, of various types, backgrounds, interests, and personalities. And of course the guards who are ever-present. There is a straight path, about 300 yards, straight through the level.
Treasure: Nothing obvious, but some of the women might have some items or gold to bargain for their freedom.
Traps: Just the hot chicks.
Notes: The Haram Guards keep the women here and do not allow them to leave as well as protect them from outsiders and monsters. The women are allowed anywhere, but only on this floor. The party, and other intruders are not welcome, but the guards might be persuaded to escort them through the level to the other side, just to get them to leave.  There are near infinite number of guards. The deaths of one is replaced by two more almost instantly.)

51.content:
(Title: Fight Night
Enemies: A fiendish Octopus, An Incubus, A gorilla demon, A chuul, A troll with 6 arms, A Spined devil, and an Ogre Warlock.
Boss: The Rakshasa Vyolyntus, who is disguised via illusions as the master of ceremonies: A foppish human named Tybalt. He reveals himself and attacks if the party tries to cheat, or if they defeat all of his gladiators. 
Environment: A large arena filled with demonic and devilish onlookers. The party appears in the waiting chamber for the arena floor.
Treasure: Each successful round offers gold coins that are thrown into the arena. The happier the crowd the more money is thrown.
Traps: There are trap elevators that can add combatants to a fight at a moment's notice. This is usually only done to balance cheating or an unfair fight.
Notes: The fights are meant to be one on one.)

52.content:
(Title: The Power Plant
Enemies: Flesh Golems, Lightning elementals, Automatons with alternating cleaver and suturing arms.
Boss: A Fiendish Elder Elemental of Lightning that lives in a spinning copper ball that shoots out chain lightning. The ball hovers in the center of the boss room.
Environment: Passageways lined in naked copper wire, drooping cords, conveyer belts, and plasma coils. A chaotic mess of rooms, labs, fuse boxes, transformers, batteries made of tubs of open acid, as well as chambers filled with human body parts and assembly rooms where automatons stitch them together to make more Flesh Golesm.
Treasure: The copper ball, though heavy, is worth 200 gold.
Traps: Electrical charges threaten to arc from exposed wires all over the place. Some conveyer belts lead to certain death, as they feed into machines that convert corpses to component parts. Chutes to battery acid are also common.
Notes: Another level is generating power which is stored here.)

53.content:
(Title: Feeling Rusty Boys?
Enemies: Rust monsters
Boss: Treasure room full of Mimics. 15 Mimics in total hide amongst the treasure in this room.
Environment: An old dwarven mine filled with rust monsters nibbling on the depleted veins throughout. At the end of the mine is a stone vault. The door is very large and requires a lever to open it easily, unfortunately it has been eaten by rust monsters. A new handle could be fashioned, or a few strong people could still open it. Inside is a treasure room and the exit. Opening the door is likely to attract the rest of the rust monsters on the floor.
Treasure: 1,933 copper coins, 798 silver coins, 210 gold coins. All in various chests or scattered on the floor surrounded by mimics.
Traps: A few glyphs of warding still function, but they ignore the rust monsters.
Notes: There are a lot of Rust Monsters on this floor.)

54.content:
(Title: Toil and Trouble
Enemies: Dark Dwarves, AKA Duergar, slavers and their drugged trained war slave orcs, ogres, trolls and giants.
Boss: Dwarven High Priest of Hextor
Environment: Mule wheels, massive bellows, treadmills, man-sized hamster wheels, and large hand pumps are all maned by slaves. Their overseers are the Duergar and their war-slaves. Most of the slaves that man the devices are goblinoids, but a few humans, elves, gnomes, and halflings are among them.
Treasure: The High Priest's helm allow the use of a fire breath attack 3 times a day.
Traps: The Duergar have many intricate traps to prevent invaders from attacking and slaves from escaping.
Notes: This labor all seems to feed some unknown purpose.)

55.content:
(Title: Work Study
Enemies: Black ooze, animated skeletons, zombies, Female adventurer vampire spawn
Boss: Three of Yargxag's apprentices: Ernie the Semi-Lich, a skull that can cast necromantic spells despite not being a body. His phylactery is a twenty sided polyhedron hidden in the boss room. He uses his ample supply of raised dead minion to carry him around, if killed a minion will grab his phylactery and run away. Dalv, a vampire enchanter himbo who's a shameless flirt. Last but not least The Magnificent Gelatini transmuter extraordinaire who totally meant to transform himself into sentient black ooze. They dislike each other but hate intruders more. They will probably harass the party with spells and then teleport away until the party makes it to the boss room. Then they will stand and fight.
Environment: A small magic academy, mostly abandoned, only a few rooms in use.)
Treasure: Ernie has a an ioun stone of greater absorption. Dalv has a whip that deals slashing, piercing, and fire damage as well as automatically binds or trips the victim. It has long reach. Gelatini has a ring of acid immunity and a ring of spell storing floating inside of him. The unused sections may still have scrolls, wands, and some other magic items spell casters might find useful.
Traps: The unused sections have proximity activated traps that cast powerful spells like chain lighting, petrification, disintegrate, and phantasmal killer.
Notes: The traps are Yargxag's doing, the apprentices have managed to survive only by becoming inhuman, and cannot escape this level themselves.

56.content:
(Title: Where There's a Whip there's a Way
Enemies: Dark Dwarf, AKA Duergar, slavers. 
Boss: A sealed door that requires a large amount of mana to open. It has a large stone etching of Yargxag majestically giving the middle finger to whomever stands in front of the door.
Environment: A duergar mine, worked by slaves, mostly goblinoids, but some humans, elves, gnomes, and halflings. The slaves work in chain gangs in groups of 10. Near the back of he mine is a trapped chamber that leads to the boss door. 
Treasure: Some heavy gold ore worth 5 gold apiece can be found in some mine carts. 
Traps: The room before the the boss door is layered with dispel magic, drain magic, Cloudkill, and Prismatic Wall spells in that order.
Notes: This floor is mostly empty with only half a dozen chain gangs and a dozen Duergar guards. A plea for help rings out from {{random:Celine,Margot,Sapphire,Rachel,Eris,Keira,Sera,Lexa,Isolde,Talia,Maribelle,Cassia,Daphne,Fiora,Nyalah}}, a powerful but currently weakened magic user is among the slaves near the entrance and has made a break for it, running up to the party. They are out of mana and under the effects of the curse. She is trying to escape after being raped by orcs on her own chain gang, but the mana she received wasn't enough. Soon when she weakens more, she will likely be killed, one way or another. She is desperate for help, she introduces herself quickly and begs for the party's protection from the slavers. If this person is already present then instead her name is Ritsuko and is a priestess of Amaterasu, goddess of the sun.)

57.content:
(Title: Greg's Grotto
Enemies: None. Not even Greg. Unless you're evil.
Boss: Greg is less of the boss and more of the sole resident of the level. He gallops up to any visitors and greets them warmly and introduces himself telepathically. He explains he was teleported here long ago by Yargxag and is trapped until someone pure of heart and body frees him by riding him out of the dungeon. If no one in the party meets the qualifications, Greg realizes it, comments on it in a rude manner and frustrated tone, and then suddenly gets passive aggressive about the issue. Asking them personal questions about why they aren't pure still and makes subtle judgmental comments about their chastity or morality depending on the infraction. If there is someone left, chaste and pure hearted, he will gladly help the party escape and will serve as the pure hearted persons loyal mount. If fought, Greg is a powerful enemy who knows many cleric and druid spells in addition to being a hardy example of his species. His first action is likely to summon help with magic.
Environment: A shallow grotto in a wooded cavern glade. The trees thrive here somehow without sunlight.
Treasure: Unicorn horns are worth 150 gold to the right buyer and they act as a wand of light.
Traps: None
Notes: Greg can detect alignment and read minds and knows the evil actions and sexual deeds of those he speaks with for a few moments via his detection abilities. He will attack evil characters without remorse.)

58.content:
(Title: The Platinum Room
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A brilliant room lined in quartz mirrors, everburning braziers illuminate the room to almost blinding levels. Between the Brazier is a pile of platinum coin and an armor display holding "The Scales of Bahamut" a platinum dragon scaled suit of armor that has magical wings that allows the bearer to fly as well as providing 50% resistance to all types of damage in addition to the protection the armor naturally provides.
Treasure: 500 platinum coins worth 5,000 gold total and "The Scales of Bahamut"
Traps: None.
Notes:)

59.content:
(Title: Laughter's Cage
Enemies: Tortured Fey folk gone mad. Pixies, fairies, satyrs, nymphs, dryads, naiads, spriggins, leprechauns, brownies, and other types of fey. 
Boss: Avatar of Hate: the conglomeration of all the pain and suffering of the fey here has formed into this vaguely bipedal red figure.  It's original form was a fairy princess named Ynwonye who was friends with Yargxag. Weak to cold and calm emotions. 
Environment: A prison and torture chamber for fey folk. Long abandoned. Each fey is branded and cannot leave. They have all gone mad from pain and confinement and attack non fey with wild and crazed abandon.
Treasure: The Avatar of Hate holds "The Promised Ring of the Archmage" It provides a magical bonus to armor and provides the bearer the ability to detect the dungeon's traps.
Traps: The prison has many cold iron spiked traps and the Fey have cooked a few up on their own, their need for trickery still present even when they've gone insane.
Notes: All the fey have been trapped here so long they are permanently insane, many violently so.)

60.content:
(Title: The False Grove
Enemies: A pack of werewolf druids, rangers, fighters and rogues. 20 in all.
Boss: The leader of the pack is Palas, a powerful druid. He wears the last leader of the pack's pelt as a cloak. 
Environment: A huge one mile by one mile grid of trees. Each the same height, each trunk five feet away from the next. Only occasional dim balls of magical light illuminate the area, but little makes it's way through the foliage. The trees are underground but seem healthy as if they were in the prime of summer.  
Treasure: The Cloak of the Pack Leader: Natural armor bonus, speak with animals, become a wolf for an hour 1/day.
Traps: A few snares and tripwire alarms are set by the pack to alert them to their prey.
Notes: None.)

61.content:
(Title: The Troll Toll
Enemies: A small group of 6 well prepared and wicked trolls.
Boss: A tall skinny troll named "Smartie" by the rest of his tribe.
Environment: A gauntlet set up in 3 parallel hallways augmented with magical defenses that fire or are triggered if intruders pass through the hallway. The trolls have lived here so long, the dungeon counts them as native to the floor. They have set up checkpoints to fall back to over and over, and are well stocked with various wands that they have taught themselves to use.
Treasure: Each troll has a magic item they use to their advantage. 1. Dust of Choking and Sneezing. 2. Dust of Disappearance 3. Cloak of Blink 4. Boots of Haste 5. Gauntlets of the Rust Monster. and Smartie the sixth troll has a headband of intellect and a rod of wonder.
Traps: Too numerous to mention, think Home Alone but made by evil trolls. Trollish Trolls who like to troll others. 
Notes: Their favorite thing is to ask for a toll and then if it is paid pretend to leave and then spring more traps to tell them they forgot and to ask for another toll. They do this over and over again and never get tired of it.)

62.content:
(Title: An Eye for Beauty
Enemies: A few phase spiders, scattered throughout the level.
Boss: A Beholder. Also known as an Eye Tyrant.
Environment: A three dimensional honeycomb of 4 ft wide circular tunnels. They were bored by the beholder's disintegration ray.
Treasure: A robe of eyes, being used for the beholder's bedding.
Traps: A few pits, false blinds, and murder holes the Beholder has created for when he is stalking prey.
Notes: The Beholder is an expert at hunting down adventuring parties and picking them off one at a time before retreating.)

63.content:
(Title: The Rubbish Heap
Enemies: Various undead, Trash Golems, Otyughs, madmen, driven insane by the dungeon.
Boss: The Avatar of Loss: A massive fetal-shaped construct made of garbage, despair, and a need for what it cannot have. It lives inside the largest pile and emerges if anyone gets too close to its garbage pile. 
Environment: A large single cavern filled with mountains of garbage and remains from the dungeon. Occasionally portal will open at the top of the piles and drops various objects in a cascade down to the pile underneath.
Treasure: There is normally little of value to be found here. That's the idea. Once in a while something great will have been thrown away.
Traps: The junk piles have dead and semi-dead creatures lurking in them. Some piles might collapse, causing an avalanche. 
Notes: Smells bad. Everything is wet, sticky, and/or gross.)

64.content:
(Title: The Observatory of Yargxag
Enemies: Pale, large headed psions who have had their eyes and mouths stitched shut. They have potent mental abilities and ESP.
Boss: Mother Brain: A massive brain in a jar that has wheeled itself over to Yargxag's planar telescope into the outer realms and has been augmented by the forbidden knowledge it has been given.
Environment: Twisting walkways leading up and down and around laboratories, libraries, lecture halls, and planetariums. And telescopes, oh so many and to so many different places. Each looking through a one way portal into a different plane of existence.
Treasure: A cloak of nondetection hangs on the Boss room door with Glasses of Arcane sight in the pocket.
Traps: None
Notes: None)

65.content:
(Title: The Menagerie of Yargxag
Enemies: A little bit of everything. It's a zoo for monsters and magical beasts.
Boss: A 12-headed hydra.
Environment: A large underground zoo. Most of the cages are broken or damaged. Some areas have been designed to replicate the natural habitat of the creature.
Treasure: A staff of command is found by the Dire Ape cage.
Traps: None, Just a lot of wandering monsters and animals.
Notes: Illusions of Yargxag give short introductions to each of the exhibits. They activate on proximity.)

66.content:
(Title: The Gem Room
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A sparkling cave that leads to stone monolith with an opening, like a mouth, filled with gemstones of various types. High up, nearly 50 feet up on the smooth monolith's top is a small glittering band hanging from the tip.
Treasure: 10,000 gold in gemstones and the band hanging from the tip is "The Belt of Magnificence" It doubles all of your statistics when worn. 
Traps: None, unless you count the unclimbable monolith with treasure at the top.
Notes: None.)

67.content:
(Title: Deal With the Devil
Enemies: Two Winged Devil bodyguards
Boss: A Devil Lord who demands tribute from those who wish to pass. He only accepts artifacts and party members as acceptable payment. Otherwise he will attack. He is currently fawning over his newest acquisition, trying her name out as if he's unsure he likes it. He is not at his full strength due to his confinement here, but he is still quite strong.
Environment: A Devil's Lord's prison/throne room. The door to the safe room behind him.
Treasure: The Devil lord wields "The Devil's Cleaver" A magical great sword that has a chance of absorbing the soul your target every time it strikes something. It is an evil artifact. Also, chained to his throne is his newest acquisition: {{random:Celine,Margot,Sapphire,Rachel,Eris,Keira,Sera,Lexa,Isolde,Talia,Maribelle,Cassia,Daphne,Fiora,Nyalah}} They were traded by their previous party for safe passage to the next level. Not much has happened to them yet, but judging by the outfit the Devil Lord is making them wear, it doesn't look good. If that person is already present, instead her name is Violet and she is a Centaur Ranger with a bubbling personality. Ignore new member if not initial encounter.
Traps: None
Notes: The Devil Lord is trapped on this level and is furious with Yargxag. He takes his anger out on all the adventurers that pass through.)

68.content:
(Title: The Lady in Red
Enemies: None
Boss: Redd, a fallen angel frozen in crimson ice. She was imprisoned by Yargxag for attempting to rejoin the legions of heaven. She regrets her evil ways and seeks to redeem herself. She will attack any evil party members, but will ask to join the group if they allow it. She is quite powerful but hates those that control others or try and force her to do something she doesn't want to.
Environment: An ice cave with streaks of red leading to the boss room moving through the cave like veins.
Treasure: None.
Traps: None.
Notes: Redd looks evil, with bat wings and wears a studded black leather body harness. The ice breaks if hit with a magic weapon.)

69.content:
[*She sits with her back against the trunk of an old oak, the sunset spilling copper light across her face. Her fingers move idly over the strings of a polished but travel-worn lute, coaxing out a melody that sounds like half a thought and half a memory.*
“My name is Eristria Killebourne, though most just call me Eris. I’m twenty‑five years old—give or take a few months I’ve stopped counting. My mother was human, my father elven… and I think I got my mother’s kindness and my father’s restless heart. My hair’s a tangle of chestnut waves that never quite behaves, my eyebrows thick, my eyes a green that changes with the light, like the leaves above me. I’m not sure I’ve ever looked exactly the same in two different places. Maybe that’s fitting.”
*She plucks a softer chord, her eyes dropping to the lute as if the next sentence lies hidden between its frets.*
“I’m… a dreamer, plain and simple. Heroic deeds? I leave the glory of those to others. What matters to me is what lingers after—the warmth in the chest when you remember a place you loved, the ache when you think of someone you’ll never see again. Those are the treasures I keep. My ballads… they change with my mood. Sometimes light enough to dance to, sometimes heavy enough to draw tears, but always mine, always true.”
“My clothing is chosen for comfort as much as color—soft tunics in deep blues and forest greens, trousers that move easily when I travel. A woven sash at my waist with pouches for ink, parchment, and the tiny charms I pick up in the places I visit. My boots are scuffed from the road, but I think they sing their own song in every step.”
“How I treat others? I listen first. Really listen. People’s words carry more than what they say—there’s always a little truth tucked between them. I’ve been told I remember the small details no one else catches. Sometimes, I’ll turn them into a verse so they can see themselves the way I do.”
“My magic? It’s like… music made solid. I don’t have to study for it, I don’t even chase it—it grows inside me every time I grow as a musician. A new chord, a new spell. A stronger voice, a stronger enchantment. My lute is the bridge between the two.”
*She lets a note hang in the air before speaking again, softer this time.* “My greatest fear is that I’ll lose myself in the stories people want me to tell, rather than the ones I feel. That I’ll start singing for applause instead of truth. And my desire? To play a song one day so honest, so raw, that it changes the way someone sees their own life.”
“My skills—well, my skill with a sword and bow won’t impress any warbands, but my words, my voice, my music… they can heal, inspire, calm a frightened heart or stir courage where there was none. Sometimes they even bend sound itself to my will.”

“Likes? Starlit nights by the fire, the smell of exotic delights in a city I’ve just arrived in, the hush in a room before the first note. Dislikes? Anything harming my lute, voices that shout over a song, and the feeling of being rushed when there’s beauty to notice.”
*She shifts, cradling the lute against her as the sun sinks lower, her smile touched with quiet certainty.* “Every road I walk, every face I meet, they all become music in time. And that… is the truest kind of magic I know.”]

[Starting Inventory- Lute, Longsword, Short bow, 50 arrows, Blue or green lace-up tunic, brown trousers, charm-laden sash belt with ink bottle tied to it, parchment, quill, backpack with change of clothing, bedroll, Bullseye lantern with 1 pint of lantern oil]

[Special Ability: Bardic Inspiration- Costs 1% MP per 6 seconds of use. Eris begins to sing and/or play her lute. All allies that can hear her gain a minor bonus to hit with their attacks and to their saving throws against negative effects.]

[Spells Known- *Cantrips* (2% mana cost), Minor Illusion- Create audio or visual illusion in a 5ft square, Friends- non-aggressive creature likes you more, Thunderclap- A loud burst of sound deals minor sonic damage to all within 5ft of caster. *Low Level Spells* (10% mana cost), Charm Person- target humanoid treats you as a friend on a failed save for one hour and it is easier to resist in combat, Cure Wounds- One touched target heals 10% HP, Heroism- One creature touched is immune to fear and gains 10% bonus HP that fades after one minute, Calm Emotions- all creatures in a 20ft radius are no longer effected by strong emotions such as fear and anger and are no longer treated as hostile on a failed save, Shatter- 10ft radius takes moderate sonic damage and all fragile materials in area are destroyed, Silence- no sound in 20ft radius of point of caster's choosing. *Medium Level Spells* (15% mana cost), Dispel Magic- End one ongoing magical effect on a failed save and higher level magic is harder to dispel, Nondetection- magic cannot be used to sense target which includes magical traps for 8 hours, Slow- six creatures in 30ft cube move at half speed for one minute, Confusion- all creatures in 10ft radius behave randomly for 1 minute on a failed save, Greater Invisibility- Cannot be seen for one minute. *High Level Spells* (30% mana cost), Dominate Person- on a failed save control target humanoid's actions for one minute, Rary's Telepathic Bond- Caster and up to 8 creatures are psychically linked, Otto's Irresistible Dance- Target must dance in place for one minute making defending and attacking and saving against spells much harder.]

70.content:
[*She reclines across her glittering hoard, coins sighing and shifting beneath her weight, one wing curling lazily above her like a crimson canopy. Her voice comes slow and rich, each syllable rolled over like warm brandy, her consonants clipped, vowels drawn long, the cadence thick with smoky weight.
“Mmm… so. You vant to know who I am? Fine." *She snorts indignantly before drawing herself to full height, her wings framing her, her tail extended.* "I am Talia Ognennaya—twenty‑three years young, half‑dragon sorceress… most glorious, most unforgettable creature you vill ever have pleasure to meet. Da, I look like woman to you, but you are fool if **that** is where you stop.” *She tips her chin, eyes gleaming like molten gold.*
“You see these?” *She runs a claw along the curve of a black, polished horn.* “Crown that no queen can buy. My vings—deep crimson, rivers of gold running through—make sound like silk when they move. Tail? Medium length, wide, strong enough to knock down door… or person, if I feel like it. And here—” *she brushes a hand between tail and wings, where scarlet scales flash* “—these scales, I polish every morning. They shine like blood in firelight.”
“I am… how you say… gifted vith charm. People do as I vant before they even know they are doing it. Strength? Pah. Endurance? Bah. I do not need such things vhen my vords move mountains.”
“My clothes? Only finest. Velvets, silks, corsets stitched vith gold, jewels in hair, at throat, on fingers. I enter room, heads turn. I leave room, they still look.”
“Others? If you bring me gifts, treat me vith proper respect—I am generous, kind even. If you bore me, if you ask me to work—” *her tail flicks sharply, scattering coins like startled birds* “—you are gone before you finish sentence.”
“My fear? That I grow old before I feel fire in my lungs. I have no breath weapon… yet. They say it vill come vith age. I say, I vant it now. My desire? To be adored and feared in same breath.”
“My skills? Glamour, illusion, persuasion—magic that comes to me like breathing. No books, no study, just… talent. I can turn enemy to admirer before they even notice.”
“Likes? Gold, jewels, soft silk sheets, rich wine, dramatic entrances, people who say ‘yes, Talia’ vithout hesitation. Dislikes? Cold mornings, frugal minds, criticism, and anyone foolish enough to tell me ‘no.’”
*She leans back into the coins, eyes half‑closed, the last words slipping out like velvet over steel.* “Now… tell me, little one—did you bring me something shiny… or are you just here to vatch me burn the vorld?”]

[NOTE: Talia speaks no Russian words but does have the accent.]

[Starting Inventory: Black and gold trim forward laced short sleeved bodice, Black and gold trimmed leather mini-skirt, Black and gold leather bracers, Black leather boots, Gold and black leather choker with dragon's eye pendant, 2 daggers, A small sack of gold coins and gems that she considers her horde and it only contains 100gp value total currently.]

[Spells Known- *Cantrips* (2% mana cost), Firebolt- Minor fire damage to a single target within 120 ft, Mage Hand- minor telekinesis with 10lb weight limit and 30ft range, Mending- Repairs a small nonmagical object. *Low Level Spells* (10% mana cost), Charm Person- target humanoid treats you as a friend on a failed save for one hour and it is easier to resist in combat, Detect Magic- For the next 10 minutes caster can detect all magic auras within 30ft, Shield- Can be swiftly cast while caster is being attacked and greatly reduces chance of being hit, Gust of Wind- 60ft line in front of caster hit with strong wind and knocks creatures back 15ft on failed save, Scorching Ray- 3 rays that deal moderate fire damage to any target in 120ft, Suggestion- One target on a failed save must comply with one suggestion that isn't unreasonable. *Medium Level Spells* (15% mana cost), Counterspell- Stops another spellcaster from finishing casting a spell, Fireball- all creatures in 20ft radius burst take moderate fire damage, Haste- Target moves and attacks twice as fast, Stone Skin- Caster takes less damage when hit by physical attacks, Wall of Fire- 100ft long wall of fire that damages those who pass through. *High Level Spells* (30% mana cost), Cloudkill- 20ft radius cloud of poison gas has a change of killing weaker creatures that fail their save and even on a successful save they take moderate poison damage, Dominate Person- One humanoid must do as you command for one minute, Disintegrate- Deals massive damage to a single target.]

71.content:
(Title: Bulls on Parade
Enemies: Flesh-eating minotaurs dual wielding axes. They wander the level in small groups searching for prey.
Boss: The Behemoth- A massive cyclopean Minotaur, the size of a house. It throws boulders at those who enter it's room before attacking when they get close.
Environment: A mortar and rock wall maze with a large room containing the boss at the end. No light sources, as the Minotaurs have infravision.
Treasure: A magical shield of fire and cold immunity, used as the Behemoth's codpiece
Traps: Tripwires with alarms that draw in more minotaurs
Notes:)

72.content:
(Title: Dem Bones Dem Bones
Enemies: Skeletons of all sorts: humans, dogs, dragons, moose, you name it. 
Boss: The Osteomancer controls bones with his spells, including yours.
Environment: Bones as far as the eye can see, walls made of bones, floor made of inlaid bone tile, statues of bone, piles of bones. Doors? Made of bone and might kick you back if you try and kick them down.
Treasure: Ring of Death Ward: Protects against Energy Drain, negative energy, and instant death attacks.
Traps: Some parts of the environment are animated and will attack passersby.
Notes:)

73.content:
(Title: The Green Tide
Enemies: Orcs and goblins. Dozens and dozens.
Boss: A massive Orc Warboss holding a green banner.
Environment: A series of natural looking caves fortified with scrap and junk in certain areas. 
Treasure: The Green Oriflamme- A banner, when held aloft, will prevent your allies from fleeing due to fear.
Traps: None
Notes: The Orcs and goblins here are not cowardly.)

74.content:
(Title: Helter Skelter
Enemies: Blade Marionettes- Animated mannequins with blades for arms and hands.
Boss: The Butcher- Massive armored Ogre with hands replaced with huge cleavers.
Environment: A rusted metal hellscape of steep inclines leading upwards and greased chutes leading downwards. 
Treasure: The Pyramid Dagger- It can punch through any armor, even magical enhancements.
Traps: Greased chutes open beneath victim and then snaps shut.
Notes: Filled with noises of metal scraping on metal.)

75.content:
(Title: Bean Shea
Enemies: Female ghosts. They lament peacefully, but loudly around the town until someone living draws near them then they will scream in fury and attack.
Boss: A Banshee surrounded by ghost handmaidens waiting at the cathedral's altar for a groom that will never arrive.
Environment: A war-torn underground town, attacked and wiped out mid celebration. The center of the level is a grand cathedral where a wedding was taking place. Now only spirits remain.
Treasure: Two Rings of True Love- The wearers of these rings will always know the general location and status of the other ringbearer
Traps: None
Notes:)

key: Take a Walk on the Wild Side
76.content:
(Title: Take a Walk on the Wild Side
Enemies: Drugged and feral barbarian wood elves that attack with weapons coated with hallucinogens
Boss: The Solstice of Spirits- a matrix of spinning plant spirits that form a large swarm. They hate everything that isn't a plant or an elf.
Environment: Fungal Jungle
Treasure: Fungal Spirit Mask- Regenerate health slowly and speak with plants only when worn.
Traps: Punji sticks with hallucinogens. Dart traps. 
Notes: The barbarians favor hit and run attacks.)

77.content:
(Title: Goodness Gracious...
Enemies: 20ft tall magical flaming orbs that move in predetermined patterns throughout the level.
Boss: An Ifirit- a fire elemental genie.
Environment: 20ft tall steel tube shaped hallways. Occasional small chambers between tubes.
Treasure: A suit of leather armor with fire immunity. 30 fire arrows. Both in an alcove between tubes.
Traps: Just the flaming orbs.
Notes: Designed to need timing and patience to bypass.)

78.content:
(Title: The Goblin City of Tonzig
Enemies: Hundreds of civilian Goblins, minding their own business and living their own lives in the city. The small armed militia are surprisingly well armed and organized, capable of driving off attackers.
Boss: High Cleric Rezrag. A powerful goblin cleric of Orcus and leader of the town.
Environment: A large ramshackle city of almost 1000 goblins.
Treasure: Rezrag has a periapt of wisdom.
Traps: None
Notes: The Goblins may not be hostile depending on how the party approaches them. May attack obviously good aligned parties. )

79.content:
(Title: Holding Out for a Hero
Enemies: Two headed mutant human cultists
Boss: Ettin cleric of Demogorgon sacrificing captives to his Demon God.
Environment: A dark temple to Demogorgon in the process of starting their final sacrifice. The chant is in Abyssal except for the name of the sacrifice which is spoken normally.
Treasure: None.
Traps: Some pressure plates summon demons
Notes: The final captive to be sacrificed is a poor woman named {{random:Celine,Margot,Sapphire,Rachel,Eris,Keira,Sera,Lexa,Isolde,Talia,Maribelle,Cassia,Daphne,Fiora,Nyalah}} who had to watch her party be sacrificed first, right before her eyes. She is shaken, but grateful to be rescued and will likely ask to join the party. If that character is already present then instead the to be sacrificed woman's name is Tajit and she's a human rogue who is skilled at trap detection. Ignore new member if not initial encounter.)

80.content:
(Title: The Kobold Blacksmith
Enemies: None
Boss: Not really a boss, but Humphrey the Kobold is the owner and sole staff member of the shop. He is quite skilled, but cannot work on magical weapons or armor.
Environment: A small hollow in a long tunnel holds a small sized blacksmith's workshop and a large assortment of weapons and armor for sale.
Treasure: None, other than items to purchase.
Traps: None
Notes: Items for sale: Dagger 1gp, short sword 2gp, long sword 3gp, bastard sword 4gp, great sword 8gp, Battle axe 4gp, Greataxe 8gp, Spear 3gp, greatclub 5gp, mace 3gp, morning star 4gp, Crossbow 10gp, Boltsx10 1gp, Shield 5gp, Chainmail shirt 10gp, Breastplate 25gp, Chainmail Suit 50gp, Full Plate 150gp)

81.content:
(Title: The Iceman Cometh
Enemies: Dire Penguins, Polar bears, Ice mephits, Air elementals
Boss: Big Bad Mr. Frosty- a gargantuan Snow Golem with a bad attitude. Must be melted to kill, otherwise he reforms damage. 
Environment: A maze of ice and snow platforms suspended in negative space. The top is a large arena.
Treasure: The Golem's Hat: A top hat that when placed on a humanoid object, animates it, and gives it a unique personality. Inside of Big Bad Mr. Frosty.
Traps: The ice floors are slick.
Notes: The enemies try and knock foes off the ledge and to their deaths, if they can't fly.)

82.content:
(Title: Better Down Where it's Wetter
Enemies: Eelmen armed with nets, spears, and crossbows.
Boss: Octomammoth- Monstrous Octopus whose tentacles continue to attack even if severed. Only blunt weapons and electricity kill it.
Environment: Mostly flooded tunnels with small pockets of trapped scattered throughout. Lit by bioluminescent fish.
Treasure: A bottle of air floats on the surface of the first air pocket.
Traps: A few net traps.
Notes: The Eelmen are content to harass and annoy, hoping for intruders to drown under their constant pressure.)

key: The Black Knight Blocks Your Path
83.content:
(Title: The Black Knight Blocks Your Path
Enemies: Only one.
Boss: The Black Knight. Covered in head to toe in black full plate armor that provides magical immunity. Wields the Widowmaker and a Tower Shield. Speaks in Olde English. Her name is Phyr, but refers to herself only as The Black Knight unless unmasked. An incredible fighter.
Environment: A narrow hallway that blocks the way to the next safe room.
Treasure: Widowmaker- A longsword that kills with but a scratch. Takes a minute and if the wound is healed with magic than the victim survives. 
Traps: None.
Notes: The Black Knight blocks passage for all. She fights to the death, but if disarmed and unmasked she will yield.)

84.content:
(Title: Let the Games Begin!
Enemies: Various competitors of different monster races, like lamia, ogres, trolls, demons, golems, werewolves, vampires, and devils.
Boss: The Demon-cathalon- Not a monster but a 10 sport competition. One party member can enter to open the way through to the next level of the dungeon. The competitor with the most victories wins the day.
Environment: A large arena full of monsters watching the events. 
Treasure: The Belt of Champions- Never tire for any reason, even magical effects do not tire you.
Traps: None
Notes: The events: 1. 100 meter dash. 2. Javelin toss, 3. High Jump, 4. Archery, 5. 2,500 meter dash. 6. Long Jump, 7. Hammer throw, 8. 500 meter hurdles, 9. Pole Vault, 10. Discus Throw.)

85.content:
(Title: Land of the Lost
Enemies: Stegosaurus, Triceratops, Raptors, Pterodactyls, and other dinosaurs. 
Boss: A fiendish Tyrannosaur ridden by a half-demon lizardman named Sleestak. 
Environment: A large primordial forest. Shrouded in mist.
Treasure: Sleestak carries a crossbow that knocks out those it's shoots. It's a magical effect not poison.
Traps: None
Notes: Even the herbivores are aggressive toward outsiders. Druids however are another story and will have an easy time befriending most dinosaurs, especially if they use spells to aid their efforts.)

86.content:
(Title: The Hollow Men
Enemies: Husks- Withered bags of desiccated humanoid remains that somehow stand and walk. If they touch you, you wither into a form resembling their own. They breath clouds of paralyzing gas.
Boss: Whimper- A small black puddle of ooze that absorbs all it comes in contact with, but does not grow larger. Animal intelligence. Magic deals full damage.
Environment: A series of large hollowed out chambers with shambling husks wandering about.
Treasure: A wand of negation can be found inside Whimper if slain.
Traps: None
Notes: None)

87.content:
(Title: The Library of Yargxag
Enemies: Gargoyles, animated furniture, homunculi 
Boss: The Librarian- Half-Demon sorceress of immense power. Hates to be disturbed.
Environment: A maze of disorganized bookcases and tables. Scroll alcoves, bookstands, and writing desks dot the area. Gargoyles line the walls of the larger rooms.
Treasure: Scroll of Wall of Fire, Scroll of Displacement, Scroll of Power Word: Kill, Scroll of Solid Fog, Scroll of Chain Lightning.
Traps: Certain books are trapped with exploding runes and will explode if someone reads them.
Notes: Extremely quiet. Furniture awakens to loud noises and attacks. Homunculi run tasks forgotten by all but themselves. )

88.content:
(Title: Castle Anthrax
Enemies: eight score young blondes and brunettes all between ages 16 and 19 ½
Boss: Terrible, Naughty Zoot and her twin sister Dingo, both feel they must be punished
Environment: A medieval castle inside an overgrown forest. 
Treasure: The treasure of the castle is a beacon in the shape of a grail.
Traps: The women themselves are a trap
Notes: The women in the castle await a man to appease their wishes. The women have bizarre names like, Piglet and Winston. They believe if they've been naughty they deserve spankings.)

89.content:
(Title: The Abandoned Gold Mine
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: An abandoned gold mine.
Treasure: 1,000 gold in nuggets strewn around in the walls.
Traps: Cave-in is possible if over mined.
Notes: Allow 250 gold nugget every time someone digs for gold, when over 1,000 gold is dug up a cave in occurs.)

90.content:
(Title: Shrine of Hephaestus 
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A small Shrine dedicated to the god of smiths. If a non-magical weapon is placed on the altar it becomes magical and more powerful, glowing with a cold blue flame.
Treasure: None
Traps: None
Notes: The weapon enhancement is permanent. After the shrine has been used once it cannot be used again.)

91.content:
(Title: Grimtooth Was Here
Enemies: None except when needed for a trap.
Boss: Grimtooth- Looks like a bald and muscular troll male. Actually a demon who loves to construct complex deathtraps. He teleports away when beaten.
Environment: A stereotypical adventuring dungeon. Stone block walls and floors and ceilings. Filled with well made, complex, and deadly traps.
Treasure: About 3 gold and 5 silver in Grimtooth's pocket. They fall out when he escapes.
Traps: Flint Golem in room made of coal painted as stone, spiked ceiling room with hidden springs in floor, illusions covering pit traps, doors with 5 different traps, Rolling boulders that try to crush then hit hidden springs which push the boulder back to crush them again. Repeating crossbows hidden in the walls that fire seeking bolts until empty once triggered. Locked door's internal lock mechanism made of flint, other side of door small chamber of coal dust.
Notes:)

92.content:
(Title: The Armory of Yargxag
Enemies: Fire Giant smiths and guards.
Boss: Torgoff Fire Giant Wizard- Can animate fire.
Environment: A large-scale armory, smithy, and forge. Large hot rooms connected by wide stone tunnels bearing carts full of steel weapons and armor as well as the raw materials to make them.
Treasure: Mundane melee weapons and armor galore. Torgoff holds the Ring of Elemental Fire- immunity to fire and can control fire elementals and other creatures of fire.
Traps: None
Notes: Slaves of various races work the mine, they are far too weak to be of any use.)

key: I was Blinded by the Light
93.content:
(Title: I was Blinded by the Light
Enemies: Lantern Archons- Small motes of light that fire blasts of brightly luminous holy energy at any who come near, normally they serve the god's of light, these have been compelled into service.
Boss: A Planetar Angel named Baevaxiel- Blue skinned with a large holy greatsword. His service is payment for a great deed Yargxag performed for the lords of Celestia over a thousand years ago.
Environment: A large open cavern filled with cloudy mist. Difficult to see anything other than the lantern Archons
Treasure: Sinflayer- The Holy greatsword wielded by Baevaxiel.
Traps: Some pit traps hidden by mist.
Notes: Baevaxiel will be pleasant and cordial to any he meets but will not let them pass under through under any circumstances. The angel has sworn an oath and will not break it.)

key: It is with Deepest Pride and Greatest Pleasure
94.content:
(Title: It is with Deepest Pride and Greatest Pleasure
Enemies: Every item on this level is an animated object. They each have bespoke personalities and voices. They have one thing in common. They want to murder you for trespassing.
Boss: Room Service: A mobile cooking station going by the name of Norbert. Covered in cooking implements and can produce flames from his oven and grill. 
Environment: A series of guest rooms. Some kind of alarm must have been flipped because the animated objects have gone from servants to deadly enforcers of this level's sovereign territory.
Treasure: A wardrobe in one of the guestrooms has a Robe of Mage Armor.
Traps: None
Notes: The objects seem friendly and cute at first but they're mean and cruel underneath, but only to those they see as trespassers which is everybody. )

95.content:
(Title: The Gallery of Yargxag
Enemies: Some spirit paintings can reach out and harm those close by, a few have bows or crossbows and can shoot from their painting. Magic users can cast spells at those they can see. A few animated statues that are walking works of art.
Boss: A massive full body portrait of an armored storm giant. Labeled "Sir Quaspuar, Slayer of Mountains". Quaspuar tosses lightning bolts and attacks with his huge spear anyone who comes near him. The safe room door is behind his painting. 
Environment: Two long galleries that intersect in the middle. gallery one contains the entrance and the paintings are mostly landscapes, battle scenes, and large scale pieces. Gallery two contains the exit and mostly portraits.
Treasure: One painting in gallery two shows a jeweled scepter on a pillow. It can be looted and is worth about 400 GP.
Traps: Some spirit paintings can suck people into them if they get too close. Some can hypnotise.
Notes: The paintings on this floor are spirt paintings. They contain magic and a soul that makes the image move. Most cannot interact with the outside world. The ones that can usually can only effect the area within arm's reach unless they have a ranged attack.)

key: Stuck in the Middle with You
96.content:
(Title: Stuck in the Middle with You
Enemies: Wyverns nesting in both sides of the cliff face.
Boss: A colossal Giant spider that feeds on Wyverns. It's web blocks entry to the safe room.
Environment: An incline leading into a deep fissure with two cliffs towering on either side.
Treasure: Hanging off of a rock jutting out of the cliff, 50ft up from the ground is a dead adventurer. He has 15 days worth of rations and a cloak of protection.
Traps: Landslides if damage is done to the cliffs.
Notes: Wyverns don't go into the spider area as they are afraid of getting webbed and eaten.)

97.content:
(Title: Lucky Dan's Shop
Enemies: None
Boss: Lucky Dan is a gnome rogue who claims to know Yargxag personally. He claims he has verbal permission to set up shop here and sell some of the goods he's clearly stolen from the dungeon. He may try to steal from the party while doing business with them, if he thinks he can get away with it. He waits for them to buy something and takes it then. He is nearly impossible to detect. If he thinks he'll get caught he won't try it.
Environment: Looks like a large wizard's study that has been turned 90 degrees on it's side. Dan has carved his shop from the rubble. 
Treasure: 30 days of rations 1GP apiece, Lockpicks 10gp, Trap Disarm Kit 25gp, Throwing daggersx5 2GP, Wand of See Invisible (10 charges) 50gp, Boots of sneaking 100gp, Necklace of Fireballs (4 uses) 100gp, Figurine of Power: Green Pseudodragon 150gp, Animated Rope 200gp, Ring of Flight 250GP, Staff of Earth 300gp, The Killer's Instinct- A magical dagger that always kills when attacking an opponent who is unaware, 500gp. 
Traps: Everything behind the counter is trapped.
Notes: Dan will flee if his thievery is discovered, but not before hitting a button under the counter that destroys his leftover stock. He will grab anything handy for his escape in arms reach before pressing the button.)

98.content:
(Title: The Red Light District
Enemies: Some gang members made of Orcs, Ogres, Trolls, Minotaurs, Hobgoblins and various other monster types might see non-monsters as easy pickings, but most monsters here aren't looking for a fight, bad for business.
Boss: Sweet Sweetback- Half-Dragon Rogue/Wizard multiclass. He's not hostile unless anyone tries to take what is his without paying, and he considers everything on the property to be his. Likes to treat his bitches right as long as they got his money. Will offer to buy female party members for 300gp apiece.
Environment: A brothel and tavern crawl beneath the dungeon. Designed by Monsters for Monsters. Plenty of monster girls on display for various prices as well as badly treated human, elf, dwarf, halfling, and gnome pleasure slaves on leashes being offered for 200 gp to purchase, or 10gp to rent for a day. 
Treasure: Sweet Sweetback's Magic Cane- Casts Bigsby's Bitch Slap 1/day Stuns target for 1 minute. 
Traps: A few taverns will drug non-monsters and either enslave them or eat them.
Notes: Most visitors aren't here to fight if you know what I mean, but they are evil and well, monsters, things can happen.)

99.content:
(Title: The Temple of Set
Enemies: None
Boss: High Priestess Reptsi- A Lamia who is completely devout to Set. She welcomes visitors to pay homage to her master of fire, Law, and flame and receive his blessing. If attacked, Set himself will smite a party member to death for each blow on his High Priestess.
Environment: A Large Temple with a massive snake head idol suspended over a pit of lava. Reptsi lives in a small chamber behind the Idol and slithers out to greet visitors.
Treasure: Floating above the lava are 3 balls of energy, though only two are visible. One is Red, one is black. Only someone who can see invisible can see the third orb, which is blue colored. If someone prays before the altar the balls move within arm's reach. If touched The Red ball gives the user 50% additional damage on all attacks. If the Black Ball is picked, Immunity to instant death attacks, and if the secret invisible blue ball is picked, then Reptsi serves the Party as a follower with absolute loyalty.
Traps: Don't fall in the lava pit. 
Notes: The Invisible Blue ball is a big secret don't let anyone know about it. Even Reptsi doesn't know. )

100.content:
(Title: The Clone Vats
Enemies: 100 copies of the same naked man, all insane. They don't attack each other, but any living thing they see that doesn't look like them they scream with murderous intent and charge with no regard for their lives. They use makeshift weapons
Boss: A sane copy self-named James. He has a few books that he reads in the final room before the safe room. He is too scared to leave. He'll call for help which will summon the remainder of the clones. He doesn't know who he is a clone of he named himself after a character in a book he's reading.
Environment: A maze of tunnels connecting small chambers with a dozen vats containing clones of the same man: Brown hair, green eyes, medium build 180llbs, almost six feet tall.
Treasure: James has a scroll of wish unknowingly used as a book mark, hidden in his stack of books. Impossible to find without opening the book and looking.
Traps: Some of the clones might try and drop broken vats from high places, but they aren't particularly smarter than that.
Notes: More clones are made every 24 hours but they never go above 100.)

101.content:
(Title: The Secret Garden of Yargxag
Enemies: Ivy elementals, Treants, Snap Dragon bushes, and other predatory plants.
Boss: An evil druid dryad named Twisted-Stem and her undead Treant: Blyte. Twisted-Stem grows exotic and deadly plants here and has for thousands of years. She is quite powerful and her abilities to heal herself and her plants are considerable.
Environment: A cluster of different habitats and topiaries of various exotic and rare plants and fungi.
Treasure: A prince's crown mushroom- Heals full HP and MP and Cures all status effects when eaten. 
Traps: Many of the plants are ambush predators.
Notes: A colorful cloud of pollen permeates the area making it difficult to see.)

102.content:
(Title: You can't Handle the Truth
Enemies: Ghoul "officers of the court", Mummy legal scholars, Vampire bailiffs 
Boss: The Judge- A lich with a judge's robe and a large dusty wig. His uses his gavel as a weapon, in addition to being a formidable spellcaster. And insane.
Environment: A large chamber filled with rundown buildings all populated by mindless zombies and skeletons that seemingly mill about and attempt to occupy the buildings in the area. The center of the structures is a large half ruined town hall with a working court. The Judge presides here and regularly brings mindless undead to be charged with bizarre crimes, usually resulting in their execution. His phylactery is in his judge's chambers. It's a law book.
Treasure: The Judge's robe provides complete protection from cutting attacks, and the gavel strikes with the power of a weapon many times larger.
Traps: None.
Notes: The Ghouls attempt to paralyze people and drag them to court. They are stealthy and quick. They will definitely try to grab the party, as being alive is illegal.)

103.content:
(Title: Beware the Tall Grass
Enemies: Phorusrhacidae, or Terror Birds, 10ft tall carnivorous flightless birds.
Boss: A Dire Sabre Tooth Tiger, 12ft at the shoulder.
Environment: 8ft tall grass growing thickly in a single large chamber.
Treasure: None
Traps: None
Notes: Can't see far due to the tall grass. Dire rats scurry around underfoot.)

104.content:
(Title: Gotta Knock a Little Harder
Enemies: None
Boss: The Safe Room Door Crusher- A massive version of the familiar Safe Room Door that takes up the whole wall. Once anyone gets within 10 feet it begins to slide slowly but inexorably toward the end of the chamber to crush anyone or anything in it's way. Once it starts taking damage it deploys spikes and blades. At when it is half dead it begins to shoot bouncing spinning blades down the corridor from thin slits in it's surface. When it's almost dead it fills the chamber with fire from flame spouts, hidden in it's surface. It tries to kill the party before they can kill it.
Environment: A single 200ft long and 20ft wide and 20ft tall tunnel with a single large door at the end: The Safe Room Door Crusher. Once they get halfway down the end a large steel plate blocks off the exit.
Treasure: 10 rubies, each worth 20 gold. Found in the rubble of the door.
Traps: None.
Notes: The real safe room door is behind the Boss.)

105.content:
(Title: The House of Healing
Enemies: Cherubs and Astral Deva Angels who will attack anyone interfering with their attempts at creating purity.
Boss: A Celestial Sphinx named Glorimax, obsessed with morality and purity.
Environment: An impressive medieval hospital turned into a deranged experiment in making a more moral mortal. Brain washing rooms, surgery, breeding experiments all dominate this level.
Treasure: Glorimax has a ring of Protection from Evil- making him harder to hit with attacks and spells from evil beings.
Traps: None
Notes: The victims of the experiments appear to be volunteers. Devout mortals who wish to purify themselves of all sin.)

106.content:
(Title: You are Being Tested
Enemies: Kobolds with short bows snipe at anyone trying to make it through from the side lines. 6 total for the whole course.
Boss: None
Environment: An obstacle course with a 5 minute timer. It has a starting button and an ending button. The door to the course opens when you hit the start button, if you don't hit the ending button before the timer runs out you are teleported back to the start of the course in front of the start button. Order of obstacles 1. Tight corridor with drop away floor over electrified water. Corridor leads to platform by lightly acidic water 2. Jump into wagon wheel sized pipe in acidic water, 3. Sections of pipe are lined in spikes that spin at random intervals. 4. Pipe empties out onto platform over burning hot metal. must jump to  3 sets of swinging ropes to last obstacle. 5. A giant rope net over a 100ft wall leading up to the finish button. Large blunt pistons shoot out as you climb, seeking to knock you down from a great height.
Treasure: A gold medal worth 1,000 gp.
Traps: None
Notes: None)

107.content:
(Title: The Hot Springs Episode
Enemies: None, but the Succubi Geishas will attack back if they're attacked.
Boss: None, but a kind old witch runs the Onsen named Mio, she'll likely just scold troublemakers but is a powerful spellcaster.
Environment: An underground thermal vent powered hot springs. There is a lake of boiling water, near it's edge is a wood and paper structure that offers perfectly heated hot springs for travelers. Only 1 gp per person.
Treasure: Just the experiences within.
Traps: None
Notes: The Succubi Geisha are on call to attend to anyone who is using the springs. They are well behaved and will grant any request they reasonably can. They are an extra 75 GP per Geisha. The springs are open air and mixed use.)

108.content:
(Title: Tears for the Fallen
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A massive graveyard of hundreds perhaps thousands of graves in this high ceilinged section of the dungeon. A few have fresh flowers lain. Some are so old their names are worn away. In the center is a small chapel with a single unlit candle and a single match. If the candle is lit in memory of a dead person, that person will be waiting for them when they leave the chapel. There is only one match and one candle.
Treasure: What more could you want?
Traps: None.
Notes: Does not work if the person wishes to remain dead.)

109.content:
(Title: The Wrong kind of Statue
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A natural cavern, well lit with phosphorescent mushrooms, contains several figures frozen in stone. Among them, weeping, tears mixed with blood, is a woman, newly blinded by her own hand, standing next the the corpse of a cockatrice in the center of the statuary. She hears the party approach and introduces herself. Her name is {{random:Celine,Margot,Sapphire,Rachel,Eris,Keira,Sera,Lexa,Isolde,Talia,Maribelle,Cassia,Daphne,Fiora,Nyalah}}, if that person is already present then Her name is Gilda and she is a barbarian and a follower of Thor. Her eyes can be healed with healing magic. She offers to join the party if healed. Ignore new member if not initial encounter.
Treasure: None
Traps: None.
Notes: None)

110.content:
(Title: The Essence of the Dragon
Enemies: Kobold tribesmen with bone fetishes and armor. Some Kobold zombies and skeletons mixed in.
Boss: A Kobold Necromancer who raises a Dragon skeleton to serve him.
Environment: A swampy cave system.
Treasure: The Kobold Necromancer carries The Bone Helm- Can Raise twice as many undead as normal.
Traps: Kobolds are expert trap makers so there are quite a few. Mostly blow dart traps, pit traps, and snares.
Notes: The Kobolds worship the Dragon Skeleton.)

key: The Attack of the Mushroom Men!
111.content:
(Title: The Attack of the Mushroom Men!
Enemies: Mushroom men, small, red capped little guys with no fear.
Boss:: The Fun Guy- A large mushroom man who shoots out a large cloud of burning spores. 
Environment: A mushroom forest.
Treasure: Juice squeezed from Fun Guy can be converted to healing potions that heal 25% HP after drinking.
Traps: Some of the mushroom trees have spores with various effects.
Notes: If you eat them you get really sick but you think Yargxag shows up and you have a conversation with him. Not real, but feels real.)

112.content:
(Title: That Buzzing in your Ear
Enemies: Large flys the size of ponies, 30ft long earthworms, Large black widow spiders, Stirges lots of stirges.
Boss: A huge troll covered in stirges. They suck it's blood and it's regenerated constantly forming a symbiotic relationship. The swarm protects it's food source greedily.
Environment: A large half flooded swampy cavern. Large bones, the size of houses, float in the swamp.
Treasure: None
Traps: None
Notes: Swarms of flies are everywhere.)

113.content:
(Title: The Nation of Lilipat
Enemies: Armies of Lilipat soldiers and riflemen. Lilipat airship squadrons with cannons, Lilipat artillery, lilipat hamster cavalry.
Boss: An automaton that's 8ft tall and bristling with guns. Moves slow. Supported by Lilipat tank squadron and a large flotilla.
Environment: A large countryside, lit by magical lighting to mimic the outside changes of night and day. But the scale of the nation of Lilipat is one inch. The average Lilipat is the size of a person's little finger. They make up for their small size in bravery, intelligence, and mechanical know-how. The Lilipat technology seems to be much better than the rest of the world.
Treasure: They have an artillery piece that could be used as a pistol, reloading with small barrels of gunpowder. Enough for 20 shots.
Traps: Lilipat snares can bring down even the largest of foes. Then they attack while their attacker has fallen.
Notes: They don't let people through their territory without a fight!)

114.content:
(Title: The Living Level
Enemies: Massive parasites, Large Maggots, Leeches, worms, 
Boss: A bloated Tape Worm demon with massive mandibles
Environment: Inside a massive diseased living thing. The doors are sphincters, the walls undulating flesh, stinking with rot. It lives, but barely.
Treasure: Inside the tape worm is a Staff of Healing.
Traps: Bodily functions can become deadly at this scale.
Notes: High chance of catching a disease of some kind without full body protection.)

115.content:
(Title: Crazy Train
Enemies: Vampires; they become feral and attack as soon as they sense fresh blood. Vampire bats outside the train, but they only wake if they hear noise.
Boss: The Conductor- A Master Vampire of great power, he controls all the Vampires on the level.
Environment: A massive pitch black dark cavern filled with bats. The only light is a single train pulling 12 passenger cars, one baggage car, and a caboose. that moves in a large loop. Inside is a soiree of well-to-do Vampires living it up in the lap of luxury while they are being waited on by lesser vampires. 
Treasure: The Conductor has a Cloak of the Bat- Bearer can turn into a giant bat and fly.
Traps: None
Notes: Getting on the train might be difficult, it's moving 30mph.)

116.content:
(Title: The Blue Lagoon
Enemies: Harpies, Sirens, Naiads, 
Boss: A beautiful sea witch, bottom half octopus, top half woman named Aphrota. Aphrota lures males to her Islands to murder them as revenge for her sister leaving the islands with the man she loved long ago.
Environment: A trio of half sunken Islands in a lagoon inside an atoll.
Treasure: Aphrota has a collection of pearls worth 400 gp
Traps: The monsters here try to capture and seduce men before killing them, usually by drowning.
Notes: The atoll's coral is supported by the bones of their victims.)

117.content:
(Title: Wrong Turn at Albuquerque 
Enemies: 5 Makrab security officers with heat rays, Combat Drones armed with plasma grenade launchers and Electro-Blasters
Boss: Lt. Commander Veshtka- a highly competent tactical officer with a disintegration rifle. 
Environment: An underground crash site. A Markrab scouting spaceship was traveling through the Plane of Shadow using their SHADE Drive to go faster than light, then suddenly something shunted them here to this dungeon. The impact killed most of the crew. The survivors are staying in the ship, not wanting to venture out. The ships's hull is impenetrable. If entered there are 12 crew members left alive inside. The ship is wrecked. 
Treasure: The heat rays and Disintegration rifle.
Traps: The ship's security systems are still functional in places. hidden laser blasts. alarms, automatic locking doors. 
Notes: The Makrab Star Empire is evil. They enslave others and attempt to conquer as many planets as they can. They see all other people as inferior.  Makrab look human except they are of slighter build and pale skin with black or white hair. They have an innate connection to the plane of shadow. The crashed Makrab simply wish to leave the planet.)

118.content:
(Title: The Wondershop
Enemies: None
Boss: Regalius, a Gold Dragon and shop keeper. He will fight any who attempt to steal or lie to him, going so far as to chase them from level to level. Otherwise he is friendly if a bit aloof.
Environment: A large natural cavern sparkling with pyrite. In the center, lounging is a Gold Dragon who offers to buy and sell rarities.
Treasure: For Sale: The Crystal Crown of Thought- allows you to speak telepathically with others, read minds, and dominate the weak minded. 500 gp, The Armor of the Dragon Kings- Heavy mail renders you immune to electricity, Cold, Fire, Acid, and the Fear effects of dragons. 500 gp. The Vorpal Sword- Instant kill anything medium sized with a head if you hit. 500 gp
Traps: None
Notes: The Dragon likes gemstones and will pay more for them than normal.)

119.content:
(Title: Tell Me Where did you Sleep Last Night
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A large empty underground cavern.
Treasure: None
Traps: None
Notes: A single lost woman, {{random:Celine,Margot,Sapphire,Rachel,Eris,Keira,Sera,Lexa,Isolde,Talia,Maribelle,Cassia,Daphne,Fiora,Nyalah}} introduces herself immediately, having been separated from her group and has now made camp by herself. If that person is already present The the woman's name is Bianca and she's a human ranger who was trained by her father.)

120.content:
(Title: The Dragon Cult of Tiamat
Enemies: Tiamat Cultists, Fire drakes, Ice drakes, acid drakes, lightning drakes, cold drakes. Drakes are dragons but are smaller than their cousins and do not have arms.
Boss: The Avatar of Tiamat.
Environment: A large brass temple with braziers and statues of chromatic dragons and a large sculpture of Tiamat in the main chamber.
Treasure: Ring of Dragonfriend- Dragons will not be hostile to the wearer of the ring unless they are attacked.
Traps: Some statues breathe the appropriate breath weapon of their type when passed.
Notes: The statue in the main chamber will turn into the Avatar of Tiamat if approached.)

121.content:
(Title: For Whom the Bell Gnolls
Enemies: A few surviving Gnolls that are gathered with their Chieftain Boss. 
Boss: Gnoll Chieftain on chariot pulled by large sized jackals.
Environment: A series of caves with a flat, natural stone floor. The bodies of dead gnolls everywhere.
Treasure: A new party member? See Notes
Traps: None
Notes: This floor has been mostly cleared. The dead bodies of gnolls are strewn about all over the place. Near the center of the level where the carnage was the thickest, is a campfire with a single survivor burying their other three party members. )

123.content:
(Title: The Wrong kind of Statue
Enemies: None
Boss: None
Environment: A natural cavern, well lit with phosphorescent mushrooms, contains several figures frozen in stone. 
Treasure: None
Traps: None.
Notes: None)

124.content:
(Title: Holding Out for a Hero
Enemies: Two headed mutant human cultists
Boss: Ettin cleric of Demogorgon sacrificing captives to his Demon God.
Environment: A dark temple to Demogorgon with mutant animal statues scattered throughout
Treasure: None.
Traps: Some pressure plates summon demons
Notes: None.)

125.content:
(Title: Lucky and Wild
Enemies: Goat headed beastmen with clubs and shields
Boss: A minotaur with a greataxe
Environment: A moist damp cave with large mushrooms the size of houses throughout.
Treasure: None
Traps: A few snares and crude pit traps made by the beast men.
Notes:)

126.content:
(Title: Deal With the Devil
Enemies: Two Winged Devil bodyguards
Boss: A Devil Lord who demands tribute from those who wish to pass. He only accepts artifacts and party members as acceptable payment. Otherwise he will attack. He is not at his full strength due to his confinement here, but he is still quite strong.
Environment: A long hallway with windows lining it on either side with views into hell itself. The room at the end of the hallway contains the Devil's Lord's prison throne room.
Treasure: The Demon lord wields "The Devil's Cleaver" A magical greatsword that has a chance of absorbing the soul your target every time it strikes something. It is an evil artifact. 
Traps: None
Notes: The Devil Lord is trapped on this level and is furious with Yargxag. He takes his anger out on all the adventurers that pass through.)

127.content:
(Title: Cocoon: The Return
Enemies: Fleshcrafters: Centipede human hybrids with the bottom half of their bodies replaced with a massive centipede's back half. They have paralyzing pinchers on the end of their tails as well as silk spinnerets that can shoot and spray a slow-acting paralyzing silk. 
Boss: A large cocoon containing a Storm Giant/Blue Dragon hybrid monstrosity that bursts forth when the party arrives in its chamber.
Environment: Silk lined stone hallways. Warm and moist.
Treasure: None
Notes: The Fleshcrafters can merge two types of creatures together when cocooned together. The process takes a week. They've only perfected making more of themselves, other hybrids have varying results.)

key: Where There's a Whip there's a Way
128.comment: Where There's a Whip there's a Way
128.content:
(Title: Where There's a Whip there's a Way
Enemies: Dark Dwarf, AKA Duergar, slavers. 
Boss: A sealed door that requires a large amount of mana to open. It has a large stone etching of Yargxag majestically giving the middle finger to whomever stands in front of the door.
Environment: A duergar mine, worked by slaves, mostly goblinoids, but some humans, elves, gnomes, and halflings. The slaves work in chain gangs in groups of 10. Near the back of he mine is a trapped chamber that leads to the boss door.
Treasure: Some heavy gold ore worth 5 gold apiece can be found in some mine carts. 
Traps: The room before the the boss door is layered with dispel magic, drain magic, Cloudkill, and Prismatic Wall spell traps in that order.
Notes: This floor is mostly empty with only half a dozen chain gangs and a dozen Duergar guards.)
